bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
run_evaluation() does not work. Suspected that model is not loaded into the trainer at any point. <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Run ImageNet example with --evaluate argument. python imagenet_example.py --evaluate
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Model is supposed to load from the checkpoint directory and evaluation on validation is carried out.

comments.comment: does this fail in every case or only with ddp back end?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sneiman>@sneiman</denchmark-link> the ImageNet example uses the wrong method. only works when at least 1 epoch of training is used. should be used instead. Also I'm working on a pull request to separate and since in cases like ImageNet, there's no test set or in the event that user will want to evaluate on validation set only.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/xingzhaolee>@xingzhaolee</denchmark-link> awesome. Excited for the PR. Let's get it into this release.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/xingzhaolee>@xingzhaolee</denchmark-link> I now realize is a private method... it's not intended to be used directly by the user. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Borda>@Borda</denchmark-link>
well, then it shall be at least _run_evaluation() :]
misunderstanding was caused by imagenet example using run_evaluation()
Are there any updates on this? The separation of .validate and .test seems very useful.
can you give an example of what you would like to do?
